ai-mn5:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn5:2.1_0: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.
ai-mn5:2.2_0: What are the teachings grouped by four?
ai-mn5:2.3_0: One person with a blemish doesn’t truly understand: ‘There is a blemish in me.’
ai-mn5:2.4_0: But another person with a blemish does truly understand: ‘There is a blemish in me.’
ai-mn5:2.5_0: One person without a blemish doesn’t truly understand: ‘There is no blemish in me.’
ai-mn5:2.6_0: But another person without a blemish does truly understand: ‘There is no blemish in me.’
ai-mn5:2.7_0: In this case, of the two persons with a blemish, the one who doesn’t understand is said to be worse,
ai-mn5:2.8_0: while the one who does understand is better.
ai-mn5:2.9_0: And of the two persons without a blemish, the one who doesn’t understand is said to be worse,
ai-mn5:2.10_0: while the one who does understand is better.”
ai-mn5:3.1_0: When he said this, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said to him,
ai-mn5:3.2_0: “What is the cause, Reverend Sāriputta, what is the reason why, of the two persons with a blemish, one is said to be worse and one better?
ai-mn5:3.3_0: And what is the cause, what is the reason why, of the two persons without a blemish, one is said to be worse and one better?”
ai-mn5:4.1_0: “Reverend, take the case of the person who has a blemish and does not understand it. You can expect that ...
ai-mn5:4.2_0: they will die with a corrupted mind.
ai-mn5:4.3_0: Suppose a bronze dish was brought from a shop or smithy covered with dirt or stains.
ai-mn5:4.4_0: And the owners used it and had it cleaned, and didn’t keep it in a dirty place.
ai-mn5:4.5_0: Over time, wouldn’t that bronze dish get even dirtier and more stained?”
ai-mn5:4.7_0: “In the same way, take the case of the person who has a blemish and does not understand it. You can expect that ...
ai-mn5:4.8_0: they will die with a corrupted mind.
ai-mn5:5.1_0: Take the case of the person who has a blemish and does understand it. You can expect that they will generate enthusiasm, make an effort, and rouse up energy to give up that blemish.
ai-mn5:5.2_0: they will die with an uncorrupted mind.
ai-mn5:5.3_0: Suppose a bronze dish was brought from a shop or smithy covered with dirt or stains.
ai-mn5:5.4_0: And the owners used it and had it cleaned, and didn’t keep it in a dirty place.
ai-mn5:5.5_0: Over time, wouldn’t that bronze dish get cleaner and brighter?”
ai-mn5:5.7_0: “In the same way, take the case of the person who has a blemish and does understand it. You can expect that ...
ai-mn5:5.8_0: they will die with an uncorrupted mind.
ai-mn5:6.1_0: Take the case of the person who doesn’t have a blemish but does not understand it. You can expect that they will focus on the feature of beauty, and because of that, lust will infect their mind.
ai-mn5:6.2_0: they will die with a corrupted mind.
ai-mn5:6.3_0: Suppose a bronze dish was brought from a shop or smithy clean and bright.
ai-mn5:6.4_0: And the owners used it and had it cleaned, and didn’t keep it in a dirty place.
ai-mn5:6.5_0: Over time, wouldn’t that bronze dish get even dirtier and more stained?”
ai-mn5:6.7_0: “In the same way, take the case of the person who has no blemish and does not understand it. You can expect that ...
ai-mn5:6.8_0: they will die with a corrupted mind.
ai-mn5:7.1_0: Take the case of the person who doesn’t have a blemish and does understand it. You can expect that they won’t focus on the feature of beauty, and because of that, lust won’t infect their mind.
ai-mn5:7.2_0: they will die with an uncorrupted mind.
ai-mn5:7.3_0: Suppose a bronze dish was brought from a shop or smithy clean and bright.
ai-mn5:7.4_0: And the owners used it and had it cleaned, and didn’t keep it in a dirty place.
ai-mn5:7.5_0: Over time, wouldn’t that bronze dish get cleaner and brighter?”
ai-mn5:7.7_0: “In the same way, take the case of the person who has no blemish and does understand it. You can expect that ...
ai-mn5:7.8_0: they will die with an uncorrupted mind.
ai-mn5:8.1_0: This is the cause, this is the reason why, of the two persons with a blemish, one is said to be worse and one better.
ai-mn5:8.2_0: And this is the cause, this is the reason why, of the two persons without a blemish, one is said to be worse and one better.”
ai-mn5:9.2_0: But what is ‘blemish’ a term for?”
ai-mn5:9.3_0: “Reverend, ‘blemish’ is a term for the spheres of bad, unskillful wishes.

ai-mn5:28.1_0: ‘Blemish’ is a term for these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes.
ai-mn5:29.1_0: Suppose these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be not given up by a mendicant. Even though they dwell in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, eat only alms-food, wander indiscriminately for alms-food, wear rag robes, and wear shabby robes, their spiritual companions don’t honor, respect, revere, and venerate them.
ai-mn5:29.3_0: It’s because these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be not given up by that venerable.
ai-mn5:29.4_0: Suppose a bronze dish was brought from a shop or smithy clean and bright.
ai-mn5:29.5_0: Then the owners were to prepare it with the carcass of a snake, a dog, or a human, cover it with a bronze lid, and parade it through the market-place.
ai-mn5:29.6_0: When people saw him they’d say:
ai-mn5:29.7_0: ‘My good man, what is it that you’re carrying like a precious treasure?’
ai-mn5:29.8_0: Then they’d look after them and look down at it.
ai-mn5:29.9_0: But as soon as they saw it they were filled with loathing, revulsion, and disgust.
ai-mn5:29.10_0: Even those who were hungry, they have not stepped out.
ai-mn5:29.11_0: In the same way, when these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be not given up by a mendicant ... their spiritual companions don’t honor, respect, revere, and venerate them.
ai-mn5:29.13_0: It’s because these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be not given up by that venerable.
ai-mn5:30.1_0: Suppose these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be given up by a mendicant. Even though they honor, respect, revere, and venerate them.
ai-mn5:30.3_0: It’s because these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be given up by that venerable.
ai-mn5:30.4_0: Suppose a bronze dish was brought from a shop or smithy clean and bright.
ai-mn5:30.5_0: Then the owners were to prepare it with boiled fine rice with the dark grains picked out and served with many soups and sauces, cover it with a bronze lid, and parade it through the market-place.
ai-mn5:30.6_0: When people saw him they’d say:
ai-mn5:30.7_0: ‘My good man, what is it that you’re carrying like a precious treasure?’
ai-mn5:30.8_0: Then they’d look after them and look down at it.
ai-mn5:30.9_0: But as soon as they saw it they were filled with loathing, revulsion, and disgust.
ai-mn5:30.10_0: Even those who had eaten wanted to eat it, let alone those who were hungry.
ai-mn5:30.11_0: In the same way, when these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be given up by a mendicant ... their spiritual companions honor, respect, revere, and venerate them.
ai-mn5:30.13_0: It’s because these spheres of bad, unskillful wishes are seen and heard to be given up by that venerable.”
ai-mn5:31.1_0: When he said this, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said to him,
ai-mn5:31.2_0: “Reverend Sāriputta, a simile springs to mind.”
ai-mn5:31.3_0: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said Sāriputta.
ai-mn5:31.4_0: “Reverend, at one time I was staying right here in Rājagaha, the Mountainfold.
ai-mn5:31.5_0: Then I robed up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.
ai-mn5:31.6_0: Now at that time Samīti the cartwright was planing the rim of a chariot wheel.
ai-mn5:31.7_0: Paṇḍuputta was setting up a certain former wife.
ai-mn5:31.8_0: and this thought came to his mind:
ai-mn5:31.9_0: ‘Oh, I hope Samīti the cartwright planes out the crooks, bends, and flaws in this rim. Then the rim will be rid of crooks, bends, and flaws, and consist purely of the essential core.’
ai-mn5:31.10_0: And Samīti planed out the flaws in the rim just as Paṇḍuputta thought.
ai-mn5:31.12_0: ‘He planes like he knows my heart with his heart!’
ai-mn5:32.1_0: In the same way, there are those faithless people who went forth from the lay life to homelessness not out of faith but to earn a livelihood.
ai-mn5:32.2_0: But there are those gentlemen who went forth from the lay life to homelessness out of faith. They’re not devious, deceitful, and sneaky. They’re not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, and loose-tongued. They guard their sense doors and eat in moderation, and they are dedicated to wakefulness. They care about the ascetic life, and keenly respect the training. They’re not indulgent or slack, nor are they leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion. They’re energetic and determined. They’re mindful, with situational awareness, immersion, and unified minds; wise, not stupid. Hearing this exposition of the teaching from Venerable Sāriputta, they drink it up and devour it, as it were. And in speech and thought they say:
ai-mn5:32.3_0: ‘It’s good, sirs, that he draws his spiritual companions away from the unskillful and establishes them in the skillful.’
ai-mn5:33.1_0: Suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and had bathed their head. After getting a garland of lotuses, jasmine, or liana flowers, they would take them in both hands and place them on the crown of the head.
ai-mn5:33.2_0: In the same way, there are those gentlemen who went forth from the lay life to homelessness out of faith. They’re not devious, deceitful, and sneaky. They’re not restless, insolent, fickle, scurrilous, and loose-tongued. They guard their sense doors and eat in moderation, and they are dedicated to wakefulness. They care about the ascetic life, and keenly respect the training. They’re not indulgent or slack, nor are they leaders in backsliding, neglecting seclusion. They’re energetic and determined. They’re mindful, with situational awareness, immersion, and unified minds; wise, not stupid. Hearing this exposition of the teaching from Venerable Sāriputta, they drink it up and devour it, as it were. And in speech and thought they say:
ai-mn5:33.3_0: ‘It’s good, sirs, that he draws his spiritual companions away from the unskillful and establishes them in the skillful.’”
ai-mn5:33.4_0: And so these two spiritual giants agreed with each others’ fine words.
ai-mn5:33.5_0: The fifth sub-chapter on unblemished is finished.
